[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Integer Overflow] Can the multiplication amount * 10 in the decimal conversion loop overflow u64 when converting small decimals to large decimals with large amounts? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Integer Underflow] Can the division amount / 10 in the decimal conversion loop result in precision loss when converting large decimals to small decimals? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Infinite Loop] If cur_decimal is manipulated to never equal target_decimal, can the while loop run indefinitely, causing DoS? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Precision Loss] When converting from decimal 18 to decimal 6, does repeated division by 10 cause significant rounding errors that accumulate over multiple operations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Decimal Bounds] Are cur_decimal and target_decimal validated to be within 0-18 range, or can extreme values cause unexpected behavior in the conversion logic? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: normal_amount()] [Hardcoded Target] The function hardcodes target_decimal = 9 - what if the protocol needs to support different normalization targets, and can this limitation be exploited? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: unnormal_amount()] [Hardcoded Source] Similarly, unnormal_amount() assumes source decimal is 9 - can mismatched assumptions between normal_amount() and unnormal_amount() cause conversion errors? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: normal_amount()] [Overflow Risk] If pool.decimal = 0 and amount is large, can normal_amount() overflow by multiplying amount by 10^9? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: unnormal_amount()] [Underflow Risk] If pool.decimal = 18 and amount is normalized to 9 decimals, can unnormal_amount() underflow by dividing multiple times? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Zero Amount] Does convert_amount() handle amount = 0 correctly in all decimal conversion scenarios, or can it produce non-zero results? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Max Amount] Does convert_amount() handle amount = u64::MAX correctly without overflow, especially when multiplying by 10? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Decimal Equality] What happens if cur_decimal == target_decimal initially - does the loop exit immediately, or is there an off-by-one error? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Mutable Parameters] The function modifies amount, cur_decimal inside the loop - can this cause unintended side effects if parameters are reused? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Upscale Overflow] When cur_decimal < target_decimal, can repeated amount * 10 operations overflow before cur_decimal reaches target_decimal? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Downscale Precision] When cur_decimal > target_decimal, does repeated amount / 10 truncate remainders, potentially losing significant value for large amounts? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: normal_amount()] [Pool Decimal Trust] Does normal_amount() trust that pool.decimal is correctly initialized, or can a corrupted decimal value cause conversion errors? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: unnormal_amount()] [Pool Decimal Trust] Similarly, can a manipulated pool.decimal in unnormal_amount() cause incorrect denormalization and value loss? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: create_pool()] [Decimal Initialization] Is the decimal parameter validated when creating a pool, or can an admin create a pool with decimal > 18, breaking convert_amount() logic? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Conversion Reversibility] If amount_normalized = normal_amount(pool, amount_original), does unnormal_amount(pool, amount_normalized) == amount_original, or is there precision loss? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Large Decimal Differences] When converting between extreme decimals (e.g., 0 to 18), can the loop execute 18 times with potential overflow on each iteration? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/pool.move] [Function: convert_amount()] [Negative Decimal] Although u8 cannot be negative, can wraparound (255 + 1 = 0) occur in cur_decimal operations, breaking loop termination? (Low)
